name: Impervious Surface Cover
functionStatement: Runoff and infiltration sustain natural flow regime, carry appropriate sediment and nutrients from uplands, and reliably cue spawning/migration of aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Percent impervious surface in the contributing watershed (and/or specified buffer). Higher imperviousness generally increases runoff/flashiness and can degrade water quality and habitat.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed

Method: Desktop (GIS/imagery and existing datasets)
howToMeasureMarkdown: Delineate the contributing watershed (or specified buffer) and compute percent impervious area using an impervious-surface dataset (e.g., NLCD Impervious Surface or a local impervious layer). Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.

inputs.label: Impervious Surface Cover
inputs.helpMarkdown: Impervious-surface GIS (e.g., NLCD Impervious Surface or local impervious dataset); watershed boundary.

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: IC Index score of 71% or greater. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: IC Index Score Between 41% and 70%. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Impervious Cover (IC) Index Score of 40% or less. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

sourceMetadata.sourceCitation: Minnesota SQT; Michigan SQT; North Carolina SQT; South Carolina SQT; Tennessee SQT
sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: Impervious-surface GIS (e.g., NLCD Impervious Surface or local impervious dataset); watershed boundary.

bin1.name: Poor
bin1.desc: Impervious Cover (IC) Index Score of 40% or less.

bin3.name: Good
bin3.desc: IC Index score of 71% or greater.
